p: Medicinal plants are sources of important biomolecules, including phenolic compounds, which are described as having various biological activities as antibacterial, antifungal, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and antitumor. The phenolic compounds caffeic acid and p-coumaric acid, identified by HPLC in the extracts of O. minarum, have already been related to antioxidant and antimicrobial activities in plants [ 51, 52].
